Posts.Content: I am new to this. Had my mammogram, found cluster of calcification in right breast. In which I had a stereotactic bx done and my report came back Atypical Ductal hyperplasia, flat epithelial atypia , calcification. Went to see may surgeon and now having an excisional bx next week. This makes me nervous

Posts.Content: Thanks to everyone. I had my surgery (lumpectomy with wire localization) yesterday. It was not bad. Now it is the wait for the pathology report to come back they said a week, I hoping earlier than that. My incision is about 3 1/2 to 4 1/2 inches long, looks pretty straight for now. Put together with glue, no staples or steri strips. nothing. I don't go back to see my BS for a month unless i have a problem. Thanks everyone.

Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by loralie I am 47 yrs old. I have been diagnoses with ADH. I have bc in my family history. I have had a biopsy for cysts. I have had a lumpectomy and removal of tissue. Doc suggested tamofin which i guess is not good since I am a smoker. Wed I go for a MRI., and Fri I go see a surgeon. Any suggestion on having preventive mastectomy. I too was diagnose with ADH. I have only an great aunt my grandfathers sister that had BC, however; my mother and her mother had ovarian cancer. My ADh was rt breast had a lumpectomy and margins came back clear. No other surgery or follow up other than twice a year visits with surgeon and gyn for now. I do have a mammo appt nx mth for left breast, 6 mth follow up radologist watching 2 places there. I too was a smoker I quit the day I found out I had ADH and I haven't smoked since. Good luck and let me know what the surgeon and Mri says. Ashland 6336
